#Text=Caleb Afendopolo
#Text=Caleb Afendopolo
#Text=( born at Adrianople before 1430 ; lived some time at Belgrade , and died about 1499 at Constantinople ) was a Jewish polyhistor .
#Text=He was the brother of Samuel ha-Ramati , ḥakam of the Karaite congregations in Constantinople and of Judah Bali , brother-in-law and disciple of Elijah Bashyatzi .
#Text=According to a notice found in a Paris manuscript , he supported himself by giving private instruction ; but this is questioned by Steinschneider .

#Text=A pupil of Mordecai Comtino at Adrianople , Afendopolo attained great proficiency in science , and , while lacking depth and originality of thought , distinguished himself by prolific literary production , based on his large library , that included rare manuscripts , partly bought , partly copied by himself .
#Text=He continued Adderet Eliyahu ( Elijah 's Mantle ) , a work on Karaite law left unfinished in his charge by his teacher , Bashyatzi , in 1490 .
#Text=The wife of Bashyatzi , who was Afendopolo 's sister , having died before her husband , Afendopolo no longer referred to Bashyatzi as his brother-in-law , but called him teacher .
#Text=Afendopolo died before completing Bashyatzi 's treatise .
#Text=Works
#Text=Afendopolo 's own works give a fair insight into the erudition of the Karaites .
#Text=Fragments only of many of them have been brought to light by Jonah Hayyim Gurland in his Ginze Yisrael ( Lyck , 1865 ) , and less exactly by A. Firkovitch .
#Text=His writings are :

#Text=An introductory index to Aaron ben Elijah ' s Eẓ ha-Ḥayyim ( 1497 ) , giving the contents of each chapter under the title , " Derek Eẓ ha-Ḥayyim , " published by Delitzsch in his edition ( 1840 ) of this work .
#Text=A similar introductory index to Judah Hadassi ' s Eshkol , under the title Naḥal Eshkol ( Koslov , 1836 ) .
#Text=Gan ha-Melek
#Text=( Garden of the King ) , his principal work , finished in 1495 , a diwan , or collection of poetical essays on love , medicine , and the active intellect .
#Text=' Asarah Mamarot

#Text=( Ten Discourses ) , containing homilies on the Passover lesson ( Ex . xii.14 ) ; on the Song of Songs as read on the seventh Passover Day ; on Psalm cxix , read , according to Karaite custom , on the seven Sabbaths between Passover and Pentecost ; and on the Pentecost lesson dealing with the Sinaitic revelation .

#Text=The introductory chapter , much of which is reproduced by Mordecai ben Nissim in his Dod Mordecai , dwells on the origin of the Karaite schism and the main questions at issue between the Karaites and the Rabbinites ( see especially Steinschneider , Leyden Catalogue , pp.127 et seq . ) .
#Text=Afendopolo 's view of Jesus given therein is remarkable for its impartial tone .

#Text=He places Jesus , it is true , a century before the Common Era , but adds : " He was , according to the opinion of the lovers of truth , a wise man , pious , righteous , God-fearing , and shunning evil .
